001package squidpony.squidgrid.mapping;
002
003import squidpony.ArrayTools;
004import squidpony.squidgrid.Radius;
005import squidpony.squidmath.BathtubDistribution;
006import squidpony.squidmath.FastNoise;
007import squidpony.squidmath.GWTRNG;
008import squidpony.squidmath.GreasedRegion;
009import squidpony.squidmath.IRNG;
010
011/**
012 * Map generator that produces erratic, non-artificial-looking areas that could be cave complexes. This works by
013 * generating a region of continuous noise and two distant points in it, progressively using larger
014 * portions of the noise until it connects the points. The algorithm was discovered by tann, a libGDX user and noise
015 * aficionado, and it works a little more cleanly than the old approach this class used.
016 * <br>
017 * Initially created by Tommy Ettinger on 4/18/2016, reworked a few times, now mostly tann's work.
018 */
019public class OrganicMapGenerator implements IDungeonGenerator {
020    public char[][] map;
021    public int[][] environment;
022    public GreasedRegion floors;
023    public IRNG rng;
024    protected int width, height;
025    public double noiseMin, noiseMax;
026    protected FastNoise noise;
027
028    public OrganicMapGenerator()
029    {
030        this(0.55, 0.65, 80, 30, new GWTRNG());
031    }
032    public OrganicMapGenerator(int width, int height)
033    {
034        this(0.55, 0.65, width, height, new GWTRNG());
035    }
036    public OrganicMapGenerator(int width, int height, IRNG rng)
037    {
038        this(0.55, 0.65, width, height, rng);
039    }
040    public OrganicMapGenerator(double noiseMin, double noiseMax, int width, int height, IRNG rng)
041    {
042        this.rng = rng;
043        this.width = Math.max(3, width);
044        this.height = Math.max(3, height);
045        this.noiseMin = Math.min(0.9, Math.max(-1.0, noiseMin - 0.1));
046        this.noiseMax = Math.min(1.0, Math.max(noiseMin + 0.05, noiseMax + 0.1));
047        map = new char[this.width][this.height];
048        environment = new int[this.width][this.height];
049        floors = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
050        noise = new FastNoise(1, 0.375f, FastNoise.HONEY_FRACTAL, 2);
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Generate a map as a 2D char array using the width and height specified in the constructor.
055     * Should produce an organic, cave-like map.
056     * @return a 2D char array for the map that should be organic-looking.
057     */
058    public char[][] generate() {
059        noise.setSeed(rng.nextInt());
060        double[][] noiseMap = new double[width][height];
061        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
062            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
063                noiseMap[x][y] = noise.getConfiguredNoise(x, y);
064            }
065        }
066        int w2 = width - 2, h2 = height - 2;
067        int startX = (int) (BathtubDistribution.instance.nextDouble(rng) * w2) + 1;
068        int endX = (int) (BathtubDistribution.instance.nextDouble(rng) * w2) + 1;
069        int startY = (int) (BathtubDistribution.instance.nextDouble(rng) * h2) + 1;
070        int endY = (int) (BathtubDistribution.instance.nextDouble(rng) * h2) + 1;
071        while (Radius.CIRCLE.radius(startX, startY, endX, endY) * 3 < width + height){
072            startX = (int) (BathtubDistribution.instance.nextDouble(rng) * w2) + 1;
073            endX = (int) (BathtubDistribution.instance.nextDouble(rng) * w2) + 1;
074            startY = (int) (BathtubDistribution.instance.nextDouble(rng) * h2) + 1;
075            endY = (int) (BathtubDistribution.instance.nextDouble(rng) * h2) + 1;
076        }
077        GreasedRegion region = new GreasedRegion(width, height), linking;
078        for (int i = 1; i <= 25; i++) {
079            noiseMax = 0.04 * i;
080            floors.refill(noiseMap, -noiseMax, noiseMax);
081            if(floors.contains(startX, startY) && floors.contains(endX, endY) && 
082                    region.empty().insert(startX, startY).flood(floors, width * height).contains(endX, endY))
083                break;
084        }
085        floors.intoChars(map, '.', '#');
086        ArrayTools.fill(environment, DungeonUtility.UNTOUCHED);
087        floors.writeIntsInto(environment, DungeonUtility.CAVE_FLOOR);
088        region.remake(floors).fringe8way().writeIntsInto(environment, DungeonUtility.CAVE_WALL);
089        int upperY = height - 1;
090        int upperX = width - 1;
091        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
092            map[i][0] = '#';
093            map[i][upperY] = '#';
094            environment[i][0] = DungeonUtility.UNTOUCHED;
095            environment[i][upperY] = DungeonUtility.UNTOUCHED;
096        }
097        for (int i = 0; i < height; i++) {
098            map[0][i] = '#';
099            map[upperX][i] = '#';
100            environment[0][i] = DungeonUtility.UNTOUCHED;
101            environment[upperX][i] = DungeonUtility.UNTOUCHED;
102        }
103        
104        return map;
105    }
106
107
108    /**
109     * Gets a 2D array of int constants, each representing a type of environment corresponding to a static field of
110     * MixedGenerator. This array will have the same size as the last char 2D array produced by generate(); the value
111     * of this method if called before generate() is undefined, but probably will be a 2D array of all 0 (UNTOUCHED).
112     * <ul>
113     *     <li>MixedGenerator.UNTOUCHED, equal to 0, is used for any cells that aren't near a floor.</li>
114     *     <li>MixedGenerator.ROOM_FLOOR, equal to 1, is used for floor cells inside wide room areas.</li>
115     *     <li>MixedGenerator.ROOM_WALL, equal to 2, is used for wall cells around wide room areas.</li>
116     *     <li>MixedGenerator.CAVE_FLOOR, equal to 3, is used for floor cells inside rough cave areas.</li>
117     *     <li>MixedGenerator.CAVE_WALL, equal to 4, is used for wall cells around rough cave areas.</li>
118     *     <li>MixedGenerator.CORRIDOR_FLOOR, equal to 5, is used for floor cells inside narrow corridor areas.</li>
119     *     <li>MixedGenerator.CORRIDOR_WALL, equal to 6, is used for wall cells around narrow corridor areas.</li>
120     * </ul>
121     * @return a 2D int array where each element is an environment type constant in MixedGenerator
122     */
123    public int[][] getEnvironment()
124    {
125        return environment;
126    }
127
128    public char[][] getDungeon() {
129        return map;
130    }
131    public int getWidth() {
132        return width;
133    }
134
135    public void setWidth(int width) {
136        this.width = width;
137    }
138
139    public int getHeight() {
140        return height;
141    }
142
143    public void setHeight(int height) {
144        this.height = height;
145    }
146
147    public double getNoiseMin() {
148        return noiseMin;
149    }
150
151    public void setNoiseMin(double noiseMin) {
152        this.noiseMin = noiseMin;
153    }
154
155    public double getNoiseMax() {
156        return noiseMax;
157    }
158
159    public void setNoiseMax(double noiseMax) {
160        this.noiseMax = noiseMax;
161    }
162
163}
